text: The Treaty of Brest Litovsk was signed on March 3, 1918 between the new Bolshevik government of Russia and the Central Powers (German Empire, Austria- Hungary, Bulgaria and the Ottoman Empire). Russia lost much of its territory by the treaty, which effectively ended its involvement in World War I. == Parties == Central Powers * * * * \---- Category:1910s treaties Category:1918 in Europe Category:World War I Category:Brest, Belarus Category:Treaties of Bulgaria Category:Treaties of Germany Category:Treaties of Russia Category:1910s in Russia Category:1910s in Germany
title: Treaty of Brest-Litovsk
